questionText: What ensures that transactions in IOTA can be executed quickly without requiring full consensus?
Why are packages on the IOTA network considered immutable?

answerOptions.answerText: They can be modified after publishing.
They are immutable to maintain transaction speed and prevent changes to dependent packages.
They are only immutable until an upgrade occurs.
Immutability is optional and can be disabled.

questionText: What is the purpose of introducing a new type during a package upgrade?

answerOptions.answerText: To retain old versions of the package.
To break backward compatibility and ensure users upgrade.
To keep functions compatible with the previous version.

questionText: How does the `VERSION` field help in managing shared objects during package upgrades?

answerOptions.answerText: It limits access to the latest version of the shared object by version tracking.
It allows users to interact with older versions of the package.
It automatically upgrades all previous versions.
It removes access to old versions.
